p: During the 2+0 growing season, the effects of orchard and date were significant for all of the growth traits (diameter P < 0.001), shoot dry mass ( P < 0.001), root dry mass ( P = 0.01), total dry mass ( P = 0.002)), whereas the date ∗orchard interaction was only significant for height ( P = 0.02). The comparisons made at the end of the second growing season (October 17, 2012) revealed that seedlings from SO3 attained a height (41.9 ± 6.7 cm) that was higher than those of SO6 (33.6 ± 6.8 cm) and SO8 (35.7 ± 5.1 cm), and that seedlings from SO7 were taller (39.8 ± 5.9 cm) than those of SO6 (33.6 ± 6.8 cm) ( Figure 2A ).
